Detailed Description

Some Bluetooth profiles support a disconnect operation. BtDisconnectRequest is the base class for these operations. It implements the basic functionality of the disconnect operations. Profile specific settings and functinalities are capsuled in pure virtual functions and have to be implemented by the concrete disconnect operations of the various profiles.

Member Function Documentation

BOOLEAN BtDisconnectRequest::Execute (   )  [protected, virtual]
 

Set controller parameters and call controller function.

The Execute member function is responsible for setting the appropriate stack parameters. After performing this it calls the PerformDisconnectControllerCall function, which is responsible for calling the apropriate stack function.

Returns:
TRUE: The setup of the stack parameters was successfull and the Bluetooth stack accepted the requested operation.
FALSE: Either the setup of the stack parameters failed or the Bluetooth stack rejected the requested operation.

Implements BtRequest.

virtual BOOLEAN BtDisconnectRequest::PerformDisconnectControllerCall (   )  [protected, pure virtual]
 

Perform stack function call for connect.

Because each service interacts with a different controller, the call into this paritcular controller can not be implemented in the base class, so this function is pure virtual und has to be implemented in the concrete disconnect requests of the various services.

Returns:
TRUE: The Bluetooth stack accepted the disconnect operation.
FALSE: The Bluetooth stack rejected the disconnect operation.
